scenarioDescription:
The 91 Aqr Exoplanetary System


Overview

91 Aqr is a star with 1.4 times the mass of the Sun, and 11 times its radius. It is located 143.61 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.56 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

91 Aqr is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 91 Aqr system


91 Aqr b

91 Aqr b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory, in 2013-07, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.70 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 91 Aqr b is 1017.600 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 91 Aqr b is 13.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 91 Aqr b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 91 Aqr, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Lick Observatory.
name: 91 Aqr - System With 1 Exoplanet
